title: Convex lens - object at 5-thirds and 5-halves f

content.question: An object is located on the principal axis of a convex lens, as shown in the figure. The lens has a focal length <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math>, and its focal point is at Point <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></math> in the figure. The object is initially at a distance <math alttext="five thirds f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>f</mi></math> from the lens, resulting in an image with a height <math alttext="h sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The object is then moved farther away from the lens to a distance of <math alttext="five halves f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>f</mi></math>. What is the new image height after the object is moved to its new location?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
